newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Gamma sells home textile retail stores.
newsitem.headline: Gamma sells home textile retail stores.

text.p: Textiles firm Gamma Holding NV said on Monday it was selling off its 24 household textile retail stores in the Netherlands.
Gamma said the sale would have a positive effect on its 1997 earnings.
The 24 stores, operating under the names of Hatema, Van Onderen, Eurotapijt and MTC-Interieurs will be sold to three regional retail chains. All 150 employees will keep their jobs.
Gamma gave no financial details but said it had decided some time ago that its household textile retail activities were not a core business.
Gamma said the name Hatema will continue to be linked to its Hatema Contract unit, a producer and seller of carpets.
